solution_line_template: There are {minutes_per_hour} minutes in an hour, so {total_available_hours} hours x {minutes_per_hour} = <<{total_available_hours}*{minutes_per_hour}={total_available_minutes}>>{total_available_minutes} minutes.

Her family was in the bathroom {oldest_daughter_time} + {youngest_daughter_time} + {husband_time} = <<{oldest_daughter_time}+{youngest_daughter_time}+{husband_time}={family_total_time}>>{family_total_time} minutes.
Mrs. Parker has {total_available_minutes} minutes – {family_total_time} minutes = <<{total_available_minutes}-{family_total_time}={mrs_parker_time}>>{mrs_parker_time} minutes in the bathroom.
